snippet: A compromise by the de Blasio administration, designed to increase participation of private schools in his signature program, permits classes on federal holidays and daily time for “nonprogram activities.”
abstract: Mayor Bill de Blasio unveils new guidelines for taxpayer-funded prekindergarten programs that will permit classes on federal holidays and daily time for 'nonprogram activities' such as prayer; is aimed at increasing participation by Orthodox Jewish and other private schools in mayor's signature initiative.
lead_paragraph: A compromise by the de Blasio administration, designed to increase participation of private schools in his signature program, permits classes on federal holidays and daily time for “nonprogram activities.”

headline.main: New York City Eases Pre-K Rules to Allow Prayer Breaks
headline.print_headline: City Eases Pre-K Rules to Allow Prayer Breaks
